title.narrative: Refugees and migrants are better protected and human rights of them are fully respected by DGMM as guaranteed by CoE instruments

To reinforce the knowledge and skills of DGMM staff to apply standards related to the protection of refugees and migrants and to reinforce the capacity of DGMM in providing (online) training on the HELP/UNHCR course on Asylum by using the HELP methodology.

target.value: Skills and competences of DGMM staff working with migrants and refugees are developed in respect of CoE human rights standards and ECtHR case law on asylum and migration and providing (online) training on relevant issues arising under the ECHR.

actual.value:
Enhanced skills and competences of staff working with migrants and refugees are developed to fully respect HR-standards and ECtHR case law on asylum and migration through training on issues arising under the ECHR. which will benefit migrants and refugees.
64% of participants successfully completed. demonstrating an increased knowledge and skills on European human rights standard in the field of migration and asylum.
The project had an enormous added value to enable front-line authorities daily work. not only those processing asylum applications. to apply standards on the rights attributed to asylum seekers and foreigners in general.
The project contributed to reinforce mutual trust and cooperation with DGMM under the Ministry of Interior where the HELP Programme had never worked before. This shows relevance of HELP courses in the area of migration/asylum paving the way to further work and cooperation. with a certain impact on the participants’ daily work practice.

title.narrative: National legal framework to prevent ill treatment and to ensure effective investigations improved in line with the ECtHR standards
The national legal framework to prevent ill treatment and to ensure effective investigations is improved in line with the ECtHR standards and a needs assessment/recommendation report is prepared.

target.value: Prepare Legal assessment on domestic law and comparative analysis including good practices; Prepare recommendation paper for legislative amendments and shared with authorities.

actual.value: A need assessment report has been finalized with concrete recommendations. based on identified shortcomings in the legislation and practices. The report concerns the assessment of the Criminal Code and the Law on Criminal Procedure on Turkey. but also some lex specialist laws. in relation to effective investigation on ill-treatment allegations. Relevant judges and prosecutors (67 from different regions) have improved their knowledge and skills to carry out effective case-law on the CHtHR. The project has contributed to increased understanding and interpretation of the case-law for the ECtHR and standards. and further facilitated relevant inputs for the needs assessment and recommendation paper and facilitated implementation. Reporting and updating the Action Plan. prepared by the MoJ for execution of group of ECtHR judgements before Committee of ministers.

title.narrative: New training module for trainers in the Justice Academy on effective investigation enhanced and reinforced.
Capacities of the Academy concerning new module on effective investigation is enhanced and its pool of trainers in reinforced.

target.value: The training modules on effective investigation and the pool of qualified trainers of the Justice Academy are enhanced.

actual.value: - Adaptation of comprehensive curricula with interactive training methodology of prohibition of torture ill treatment. - 2 complementary reference guides on the jurisprudence of the High Court of Turkey and Case-Law developed. Pool of Trainers (22 in total) after intensive training of trainers (TOT). who will enhance the capacities of the training department to deliver better quality trainings based on the training curricula developed. - Improved knowledge and understanding of the relevant judges and prosecutors trained to better understand the standards on prohibition for torture and ill-treatment and fight against impurity. - Checklist to better guide prosecutors and judges in investigation allegations of ill-treatment and torture developed in line with the case-law of the Constitutional Court and the European court of Human Rights towards effective investigation of allegations of ill-treatment. - 67 judges and prosecutors were trained. 2 workshops and 2 study tours conducted.

title.narrative: The Asylum and the ECHR online HELP course (national adapted version) which is available on HELP platform
- HELP course adapted to national legal order(s) and implemented for selected group of participants and available to any user on the HELP online platform

target.value: 1. CoE/HELP handbooks in Turkish are published and distributed. 2. HELP Training-of-Trainers (ToT) sessions on human rights training methodology are organised.

actual.value: The project contributed to enhance skills and knowledge of the DGMM staff to fully respect the human rights of migrants and refugees. This was done by: Implementing UNHCR/HELP online course on Asylum and ECHR for selected group of participants. development and translation to Turkish of a national version. adapted to the Turkish legal order and the specific needs of DGMM staff. Making available Turkish versions of two HELP online courses (under supervision of a senior DGMM lawyer. who also acted as main DGMM project interlocutor) to any user through the HELP online platform. Translation and disseminating of relevant CoE publications and handbooks to Turkish. Ensuring placement of a senior DGMM lawyer (and main tutor overseeing simultaneous training of the HELP Turkish course on Asylum and ECHR) at the European Court of Human Rights. 200 participants (64%) successfully completed the course with increased knowledge and skills on European HR-standard in the field of migration and asylum.

title.narrative: The knowledge of Turkish authorities to effectively conduct investigations and combat ill-treatment and impunity improved and strengthened
Contribute to the improvement and strengthening of the knowledge of Turkish authorities to effectively conduct investigations and to combat ill-treatment and impunity.

target.value: The decrease in the number of complaints to the national authorities and in the number of the cases brought before national courts and also ECtHR. for not respecting human rights of refugees and migrants.
